commits.message:
Thriveopedia wiki content with organelle pages (#4522)

* First attempt at auto-generating organelle pages

* Remove unnecessary extra scene

* Make wiki section adding generic

* Use more generic approach to pages

* Add new pages in between

* Slightly nicer recursion

* Auto generate root file too

* Add ALL THE ORGANELLES

* Text update

* Neaten up WikiUpdater

* Fix translations

* Missed translation key

* General cleanup

* Appease linter

* Revert unintended changes

* Try to fix accidental submodule change

* Fix(?) translation files that somehow got messed up

* Simple review changes

* Formatting

* Add TODO and use alternative bullet character

* Replace yes/no with icons

* Get icon as texture from common method

* Revert submodule changes again

* Rewrite translation replacement algorithm

* Further review changes

* Use regex for key parsing

* Remove question mark

pull_request.title: Thriveopedia wiki content with organelle pages
pull_request.body:
**Brief Description of What This PR Does**

* Adds wiki updating script to generate JSON file with wiki structure and populate English translations
* Adds architecture for generating wiki pages in game using the JSON wiki
* Fills wiki with all organelle pages (which have minimal content at the moment)

![image](https://github.com/Revolutionary-Games/Thrive/assets/7430433/f989bbf4-4420-4a3c-8178-793badb26ba4)

comment.body: Left that in by accident as I was trying to get the regex right. Removed.

What's the `?` mark part about in the regex. It's otherwise pretty clear to me. `.*` will match 0 or more characters and `?` will match 0 or 1 of the previous regex part. So to me that question mark shouldn't even do anything...

issue.title: Updating the JSON to unify format of variables
issue.body:
**Updating the JSON to unify format of variables**

Converts all the second layer variables into PascalCase instead of camelCase
Ignore first layer and any variables of length 1 (e.g. x, y, z)
Ignore all variables in the `AvailableUpgrades' objects in organelles.json


**Related Issues**

-->

comment.body:
I'm going to guess the problem is one place has "Iron" rather than "iron" and as that capitalized version doesn't match the internal name it fails. This isn't very fruitful to try to fix without being able to run the game.

@elj40 did you see our setup instructions at: https://github.com/Revolutionary-Games/Thrive/blob/master/doc/setup_instructions.md ?

comment.body:
Hmm, game fails to launch on this branch.

[Report.txt](https://github.com/Revolutionary-Games/Thrive/files/13179810/Report.txt)
Ah true, regex would be be more robust than contains. I’ll fix that this evening. Otherwise though I don’t think there’s a real difference in these approaches.

comment.body: I would have used a regex to detect and extract the msgid (as I've written this kind of .po file parsing before for the check scripts) and I would have basically structured a loop to read the file line by line and copy it to the output unless the regex matched. In that case I would have omitted the previous content and written the new data to the file before continuing to loop. It's almost the same as your approach (though I see you handled the fuzzy corner cases, so in the end my simple approach would probably have gotten a bit more complicated when it was hit with real data). What I would have ended up writing would have been pretty close to what you wrote, but I would have used a regex to ensure that the msgid extraction isn't able to go wrong and accidentally process like a commented out line with msgid text on it (which I think your script might be able to hit and get into an incorrect state).

comment.body: Changed to this approach which (after adding `yield return directChild` as well) seems to behave the same.

comment.body: Ah my bad, the only page we need to add in order here is WikiRoot, since the actual wiki pages are added as its children wherever it is in the tree. I think I'll move it anyway since as I said it might be better to show the current world information first.
